thread.title: Gov. Kay Ivey awards $1.36M to aid crime victims in central and north Alabama
thread.title_full: Gov. Kay Ivey awards $1.36M to aid crime victims in central and north Alabama

author: Austin Pylant
title: Gov. Kay Ivey awards $1.36M to aid crime victims in central and north Alabama
text:
MONTGOMERY, Ala. — Gov. Kay Ivey has announced $1.36 million in grants to seven nonprofit agencies in central and north Alabama that provide support to victims of domestic violence, sexual assault, and other crimes.
“Crimes like domestic violence can shatter lives and devastate families, leaving victims in critical need of shelter, healing and help finding justice,” Gov. Ivey said. “These organizations offer a safe haven and professional assistance for people looking to rebuild their lives.”
The grants are being administered by the Alabama Department of Economic and Community Affairs (ADECA) with funds provided by the U.S. Department of Justice. ADECA Director Kenneth Boswell said the nonprofits are essential resources for the communities they serve, providing compassionate care and professional support to victims.
The recipients and their grants include:
- 2nd Chance Inc. – $241,256 and $79,110 to support services such as shelter, advocacy, and legal assistance in Calhoun, Cleburne, Etowah, and Talladega counties.
- SafeHouse of Shelby County Inc. – $399,482 for domestic and sexual violence response programs in Chilton, Clay, Coosa, and Shelby counties.
- Birmingham AIDS Outreach – $106,557 for programs assisting victims of domestic violence, assault, theft, fraud, and other crimes across nine counties, including Jefferson, Madison, and Tuscaloosa.
- Family Services Center (Huntsville) – $65,404 for counseling, housing, and financial support for victims, serving 12 counties including Madison, Limestone, and Morgan.
- Family Services Center of Calhoun County Inc. – $34,539 for services addressing domestic violence, child abuse, human trafficking, and other crimes.
- AIDS Action Coalition of Huntsville (Thrive Alabama) – $57,014 to support victims of abuse, sexual assault, bullying, and robbery in multiple north Alabama counties.
- AshaKiran – $384,338 for programs assisting survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, and human trafficking in Jackson, Limestone, Madison, and Montgomery counties.

organizations.name: Alabama Department of Economic and Community Affairs
